meta.hint:
A pronoun is a word that takes the place of a noun or nouns.
Use 'he' and 'him' for one boy or man.
John is here.
example He sees you.
example You see him.

Use 'she' and 'her' for one girl or woman.
Kate is here.
example She sees you.
example You see her.

Use 'it' for one thing.
There is a rabbit here.
example It sees you.
example You see it.

Use 'we' and 'us' for more than one person, with I or me.
John and I are here.
example We see you.
example You see us.

Use 'they' and 'them' for more than one person or thing.
John and Kate are here.
example They see you.
example You see them.

content.description: Sonam and Ritika are in Pune. I will meet _____ today.
Mom and I went to the market. ___ bought some vegetables.
